intro: Dimorphanthera parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved dimorphanthera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Orchidaceae family, which includes many species of orchids. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and fragrant, pale yellow flowers that bloom during the wet season. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
